args: Happy Dragonyule! Let's have some\nfun, everyone!
Everyone looks like they're having a\ngreat time. What are you all doing?
It's a party, Lily! A Dragonyule party!
Just a small one, though. Figured we'd\nmake a little noise, get some food,\nexchange presents, that sort of thing.
But hey, not every party's gotta be a rager.\nYou should join us, by the way!
What about those two?\nShouldn't we invite them?
I don't think they'd join in even if we did.
Well that's kinda sad.\nI'm gonna try, at least!
Wait, I—aaand she's gone. Welp.\nGood luck with those party poopers, kid.
Hey, aren't you lonely over here?\nCome party with us!
Shut up. I ain't gettin' involved.
I don't like big crowds.\nMakes me feel tied down.
Hrmmm... Fine, but I'm not gonna\ngive up on you! Just you wait!
Do they hate me or something?
Heya, Lily. Why the long face?
I see. So they up and left, huh?
Do you think I offended them somehow?
No, not at all, Lily. Those two can be...\nWell, let's just say they're not the most\nstraightforward people around.
I do want to ask, though—why are you\ntrying so hard to get them to join in?
*sniffle* It's just that they seem so...\nlonely. It makes my heart hurt a little.
Yeah, like...they're all on their own. Isn't\nthat kind of sad? I was really lonely by\nmyself until I met you and everyone else.
I don't want them to feel like I did.
Damn kid... I'm calling shenanigans on\nthe crying.
Aw. The Mad Dog, moved by a little girl's\ntears. Turns out you're actually a softie.
Not really. But...she's crying for us,\nyou know.
What, so she just decides on her own that\nwe're ＂lonely＂ and then has the nerve to\nstart bawlin' about it? Talk about annoying.
Indeed. Even if we are alone,\nyou and I no longer feel loneliness.
At some point, solitude became\nthe new norm for each of us.
Psh, speak for yourself. I got friends.
Hee hee. Sorry. But you aren't exactly the\nmost trusting guy in the world, are you?

In that way, you and I are the same—we
instinctively keep distance from people.
We don't feel loneliness. In fact,
our solitude is our strength.
But by the same coin, that strength comes\nat the cost of our ability to show kindness—\nthe kindness those tears of hers represent.

If we had someone to reach out to us
before we got accustomed to being alone,
the way she did, maybe things would have
been different.
Instead of shielding our hearts in sinew,\nwe could've opened them to affection...\nAnd we could've ended up like her. Maybe.
No point in wondering ＂what if.＂ If I were\nnicer, I wouldn't be the guy I am now.
But hey, I'm not heartless enough\nto shake off the kid's gesture.
Well said. Shall we go, then?
Hey. Turn off the waterworks, kid.\nSaint Starfall ain't no crybaby.
If you've got something on your mind,\nyou should just spit it out.
Doesn't make a lick of sense for you to\nget up in our faces day after day, shoutin'\nabout party this and party that.
And I'll have you know that I'm not lonely\nat all. Flying solo's just how I do things.
Our hearts don't hold the same kindness\nyours does. Likely because we've never\ncome across anyone quite like you before.
Hee hee. Maybe this is all still a bit\nover your head. But with all that said...
I wouldn't mind talking with you more.\nMy gut tells me you know a thing or two\nabout a whole world I'm unfamiliar with.
Will you allow me to accompany you to\na party?
*gasp* Really?!\nYou want to go to a party with me?
Yay! Thanks so much, you two!
See you around, you two.\nIt's Dragonyule. Have some fun.
We'll be going now. Off to a new world,\nescorted by an adorable little Saint\nStarfall.
She doesn't make a lick of sense.\n...Hey, wait up!
I really can't believe she's managed\nto rope them into the group.
It's a Dragonyule miracle...and all\nprecisely because our kind friend Lily\nknows what it means to be lonely.
